title: How to use `rvdat`
text: First, always beginning rvdat workflow, tell R vdat.exe located. Mine within installed version Fathom Connect. don’t want every time re-open R, can add RVDAT_EXE="PATH_TO_VDAT.EXE" .Renviron file. ’re Linux MacOS, can also add location Wine installation RVDAT_WINE_EXE="/path//Wine". rvdat automatically look .Renviron restart R. can manually, find easiest way edit .Renviron using usethis::edit_r_environ(). Next, let’s download sample VRL file glatos package using utils::download.file. ’ll keeping everything temporary directory just keep tidy.
code: library(rvdat) vdat_here("c:/program files/innovasea/fathom connect/vdat.exe") #> ℹ VDAT detected in Wine installation. #> Warning: vdat.exe not found at c:/program #> files/innovasea/fathom connect/vdat.exe, #> but at ~/.wine/drive_c/Program #> Files/Innovasea/Fathom Connect/vdat.exe. #> [1] "~/.wine/drive_c/Program Files/Innovasea/Fathom Connect/vdat.exe" td <- file.path(   tempdir(),   "vignette" )  dir.create(   td )  download.file(   url = file.path(     "https://github.com/ocean-tracking-network/glatos/raw/dev/inst/extdata",     "detection_files_raw/VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"   ),   destfile = file.path(     td,     "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"   ),   mode = "wb",   quiet = TRUE )

title: How to use `rvdat`
text: take quick glimpse VDAT file’s metadata, can use vdat_inspect. Note works VDAT files (.vrl .vdat), exported CSVs. vdat_insepct converts information data.frame ’d like keep around.
code: inspect_df <- vdat_inspect(   file.path(td, "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl") ) #> ℹ Using Wine mode: EXPERIMENTAL! #> Error in `error_file_location()` at rvdat/R/vdat_inspect.R:18:5: #> ✖ Call to VDAT failed with error: #>   00b8:err:environ:init_peb starting #>   L"C:\\windows\\Microsoft.NET\\Framework\\v4.0.30319\\mscorsvw.exe" #>   in experimental wow64 mode !! ERROR: #>   Invalid Argument: file is required #> ℹ Is the location of #>   /tmp/RtmpZfiiUk/vignette/VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl #>   correct?  head(inspect_df) #> Error: object 'inspect_df' not found

what: Converting VDAT file to a CSV
title: How to use `rvdat`
text: Now VRL play know something , let’s convert csv. ’s pretty quick vdat_to_csv. vdat respectful data never overwrites files exist directory. ’ll just tack time stamp name newly-exported file.
code: vdat_to_csv(   file.path(td, "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"),   outdir = td ) #> ℹ Using Wine mode: EXPERIMENTAL! #> Error in `error_file_location()` at rvdat/R/vdat_to.R:105:5: #> ✖ Call to VDAT failed with error: #>   !! ERROR: Invalid Argument: file is #>   required #> ℹ Is the location of #>   /tmp/RtmpZfiiUk/vignette/VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl #>   correct?  list.files(td, pattern = "VR2AR") #> [1] "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl" vdat_to_csv(   file.path(td, "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"),   outdir = td ) #> ℹ Using Wine mode: EXPERIMENTAL! #> Error in `error_file_location()` at rvdat/R/vdat_to.R:105:5: #> ✖ Call to VDAT failed with error: #>   !! ERROR: Invalid Argument: file is #>   required #> ℹ Is the location of #>   /tmp/RtmpZfiiUk/vignette/VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl #>   correct?  list.files(td, pattern = "VR2AR") #> [1] "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"

what: Converting a VDAT file to a CSV with time correction
title: How to use `rvdat`
text: Adding time_corrected = TRUE argument vdat_to_csv corrects clock drift using vdat’s internal algorithm: new column added time corrected microsecond.
code: vdat_to_csv(   file.path(td, "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"),   outdir = td,   time_corrected = TRUE ) #> ℹ Using Wine mode: EXPERIMENTAL! #> Error in `error_file_location()` at rvdat/R/vdat_to.R:105:5: #> ✖ Call to VDAT failed with error: #>   !! ERROR: Invalid Argument: file is #>   required #> ℹ Is the location of #>   /tmp/RtmpZfiiUk/vignette/VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl #>   correct? corrected <- read.csv(   list.files(td, pattern = "VR2AR.*\\]\\.csv$", full.names = TRUE)[2],   header = FALSE ) #> Error in file(file, "rt"): invalid 'description' argument  corrected[46, c(2:3)] #> Error: object 'corrected' not found

what: Splitting a VDAT file into a folder of CSVs
title: How to use `rvdat`
text: outlined vignette('vdat-data-structure'), flat CSV exported via vdat_to_csv mush-together available data types VDAT file. vdat.exe can split folder files according data type , accessible via rvdat ways: vdat_to_folder("PATH_TO_FILE"), convenience wrapper around… vdat_to_csv("PATH_TO_FILE", folder = TRUE), convenience wrapper around… vdat_call(c('convert', '--format=csv.fathom.split', 'PATH_TO_FILE')).
code: vdat_to_folder(   file.path(td, "VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl"),   outdir = td ) #> ℹ Using Wine mode: EXPERIMENTAL! #> Error in `error_file_location()` at rvdat/R/vdat_to.R:105:5: #> ✖ Call to VDAT failed with error: #>   !! ERROR: Invalid Argument: file is #>   required #> ℹ Is the location of #>   /tmp/RtmpZfiiUk/vignette/VR2AR_546310_20190613_1.vrl #>   correct?  list.dirs(td, full.names = F, recursive = F) #> character(0)  list.files(   list.dirs(td, full.names = T, recursive = F) ) #> character(0)

title: How to use `rvdat`
text: Though just used VR2AR’s VRL file , works multiple different receiver styles file types. example, HR-180 VDAT file:
code: download.file(   url = file.path(     "https://github.com/ocean-tracking-network/glatos/raw/dev/inst/extdata",     "detection_files_raw/HR2-180_461396_2021-04-20_173145.vdat"   ),   destfile = file.path(     td,     "HR2-180_461396_2021-04-20_173145.vdat"   ),   mode = "wb",   quiet = TRUE )  hr_output <- vdat_inspect(   file.path(td, "HR2-180_461396_2021-04-20_173145.vdat") ) #> ℹ Using Wine mode: EXPERIMENTAL! #> Error in `error_file_location()` at rvdat/R/vdat_inspect.R:18:5: #> ✖ Call to VDAT failed with error: #>   !! ERROR: Invalid Argument: file is #>   required #> ℹ Is the location of #>   /tmp/RtmpZfiiUk/vignette/HR2-180_461396_2021-04-20_173145.vdat #>   correct? head(hr_output) #> Error: object 'hr_output' not found

title: Extracting environmental data with `rvdat`
text: ’re ACT member, log MATOS account. ’re , ’ll skip next section assume already files ready. Next, tell rvdat location vdat.exe executable (check rvdat documentation information ). Using matos, ’m going find VDAT files associated Mid-Bay Chesapeake Backbone array. Note things like temperature tilt logged within VRL/VDAT files, “detections” file type. ’ll download first file temporary directory.
code: matos_login() #> ! Please log in. #> v Login successful! vdat_here() detection_files <- list_project_files(   project = "UMCES Chesapeake Backbone, Mid-Bay",   file_type = "detections" )  head(detection_files) #>   project                  file_type upload_date #> 3     161 Tag Detections - .vfl file  2024-08-06 #> 4     161 Tag Detections - .vfl file  2024-08-06 #> 5     161 Tag Detections - .vfl file  2024-08-06 #> 6     161 Tag Detections - .vfl file  2024-08-06 #> 7     161 Tag Detections - .vfl file  2024-08-06 #> 8     161 Tag Detections - .vfl file  2024-08-06 #>                     file_name #> 3 VR2AR_551436_20240805_1.vrl #> 4 VR2AR_551431_20240805_1.vrl #> 5 VR2AR_550744_20240805_1.vrl #> 6 VR2AR_550740_20240805_1.vrl #> 7 VR2AR_550737_20240805_1.vrl #> 8 VR2AR_545764_20240805_1.vrl #>                                                       url #> 3 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/13872 #> 4 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/13871 #> 5 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/13870 #> 6 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/13869 #> 7 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/13868 #> 8 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/13867 get_project_file(   url = detection_files$url[1],   out_dir = tempdir() ) #>  #> -- Downloading files --------------------------------------------------- #> v File(s) saved to: #>    C:\Users\darpa2\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpusjJ5z\VR2AR_551436_20240805_1.vrl #> [1] "C:\\Users\\darpa2\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpusjJ5z\\VR2AR_551436_20240805_1.vrl"  vrl_file <- list.files(tempdir(), pattern = "vrl$", full.names = T)

title: Extracting environmental data with `rvdat`
text: can pull variables similar manner. Take, example, receiver tilt, located ATTITUDE.csv.  Depth, DEPTH.csv:  Battery, BATTERY.csv:  Noise, actually diagnostic file DIAG.csv: Hourly summaries pings detections also diagnositc file:   really located DET.csv. data gleaned particular receiver programmed particular way – note many data fields empty! Depending receiver, programmed , arguments passed rvdat (time correction, anyone?), split CSV look rather different.
code: env_import <- function(file) {   hold <- list.files(     tempdir(),     pattern = file,     full.names = T,     recursive = T   ) |>     read.csv(skip = 1)    names(hold) <- gsub("[_\\.]", "", tolower(names(hold)))    hold$devicetimeutc <- as.POSIXct(hold$devicetimeutc,     tz = "UTC",     format = "%F %T"   )    hold }  tilt <- env_import("ATTITUDE")  plot(tiltdeg ~ devicetimeutc, data = tilt, type = "l") depth <- env_import("DEPTH")  plot(depthm ~ devicetimeutc, data = depth) battery <- env_import("BATTERY")  plot(batteryvoltagev ~ devicetimeutc, data = battery) diagnostics <- env_import("DIAG")  plot(noisemeanmv ~ devicetimeutc, data = diagnostics) plot(ppmdetections ~ devicetimeutc, data = diagnostics) plot(ppmpings ~ devicetimeutc, data = diagnostics) dets <- title: Lightweight Access to VDAT Shell Commands

title: Lightweight Access to VDAT Shell Commands
text: Fathom Connect Windows-specific program, ’re running Windows, ’re luck! Just extract run installer, paying attention directory program installed. default install location Windows machines C:\Program Files\Innovasea\Fathom Connect.

title: Lightweight Access to VDAT Shell Commands
text: Innovasea provide non-Windows version Fathom Connect vdat.exe. ’re little bit work, can run vdat.exe, thus rdvat, using Wine. Install Wine Linux distribution choice, followed Winetricks; latter used install needed Windows .NET frameworks: v4.5.2 needed run installer v 4.8 needed run program. Note ~1.75GB installation. installing, initiate Wine via wineboot, use winetricks set Wine run Windows 10 (greater) install needed .NET frameworks. Now, need install Fathom Connect. installer usually named something like “Install-Fathom-Connect-SOMELONGVERSION.msi”, switch “Fathom-Connect-Installer.msi” . things don’t work ’re working headless, run wine uninstaller install via GUI interface. Yes, “uninstaller” (counter-intuitive).
code: wineboot winetricks -q win10 dotnet452 dotnet48 wine msiexec /i Fathom-Connect-Installer.msi /qb

title: Lightweight Access to VDAT Shell Commands
text: contributing, please use following general style: functions call vdat.exe use vdat_call. Create informative messages, warnings, errors using cli package. summary:
code: a_new_wrapper <- function(some_command) {   vdat_call("--do this")    cli::cli_alert_success("Woohoo!!") }

title: Miscellaneous functions for package checking, building, and CI — CI_utilities
text: skip_example_on_ci skip_example_on_runiverse check environment variables called "CI" "MY_UNIVERSE", respectively, return TRUE exist. Used run examples package built locally chance vdat.exe exists. package built continuous integration platform like GitHub Actions, "CI" variable TRUE skip_example_on_ci return FALSE. built locally, "CI" "" skip_example_on_ci return TRUE. Similarly, package built R-Universe, "MY_UNIVERSE" variable universe's name.

title: rvdat 0.3.0
text: BREAKING CHANGE: rvdat now looks environmental variable RVDAT_EXE rather VDAT_EXE. set sessions, need update .Renviron accordingly. Experimental support Linux Mac systems wrapping calls vdat.exe call Wine. Needs Wine Winetricks installed, (~1.75 GB total!) bandage rather actual implementation.

title: rvdat 0.2.0
text: vdat_here now looks vdat executable OS-standard installation locations. Miscellaneous test updates accommodate changes version 11.0.1 vdat executable. See differences : @e5b8803 Update README Fathom now installs .../Innovasea/Fathom Connect instead .../Innovasea/Fathom.
